bibl.title: Letter from Robert Montgomery to John J. Moran, July 8, 1938

div1.p: Montgomery appreciates Moran's satisfaction at having Montgomery portray him in the film “Yellow Jack.” He solicits Moran's reaction to the film.

div1.head: Letter from Robert Montgomery to John J. Moran, July 8, 1938
div1.opener:
ROBERT MONTGOMERY
METRO-GOLDWYN-MAYER STUDIOS
CULVER CITY
July
8th,
1938.
Mr. John J. Moran,
c/o Cia. Sunoco de Cuba, S.A.,
Avenida Menocal Nos. 455-457,
Havana,
Cuba.
My dear Mr. Moran:
div1.p:
By a devious route, your letter of
May 27th has finally reached me and it gives
me a great deal of pleasure to know that you
are satisfied to have me cast as “Sergeant
O'Hara” in the filming of “Yellow Jack”.

Of all the roles that I have
essayed, there are few that I have enjoyed
as much as this one, and I hope I have done
it justice.

The reviewers have been most kind
in their comments about the picture; but I
would like to know your opinion. Won't you
write again when you have seen the picture?

Assuring you that I shall certainly
avail myself of your kind invitation to “look
you up” if I ever find myself in Havana, I am
